title: Is design dead?
content:
Some time ago I found myself reading an article, not sure if it was a downloaded PDF or online, and it made a statement something to the effect "…we are no longer climbing corporate ladders, breaking glass ceilings…"

I think I ended up there following a discussion thread here, but without a working search engine I cannot find it.

I spent an hour or so with Google and came across this article…

[http://peoplethings.com/andblog/is-graphic-design-dead/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100304135711/http:/peoplethings.com/andblog/is-graphic-design-dead/ "http://peoplethings.com/andblog/is-graphic-design-dead/")

…which I believe I came across on my way to the afore mentioned article.

Can anyone direct me to this mystery article?

Thanks in advance.
author: Christopher Dean

comments.content:
Try this:

[http://lib.asu.edu/one](http://web.archive.org/web/20100304135711/http:/lib.asu.edu/one "http://lib.asu.edu/one")

It will search every major academic resource databases

I hope this helps!
Thank's for the link. I'll keep that in my back pocket. The article I'm looking for was more of a Newsweek style article. Not so academic.
I think I saw something like that on Design Observer. Try searching there.
